title: Implement SQLite↔JSONL sync CLI
description: PRD FR11 calls for SQLite primary storage with JSONL git-sync export/import. The CLI  subcommands currently print 'not yet implemented'. We already have storage::jsonl export/import/status helpers; wire them into the CLI so users can flush SQLite → .demiarch/sync/*.jsonl, import JSONL back into SQLite, and view status. Detect active project from current dir or most recent project with a saved path and surface helpful errors when no project is registered.
acceptance_criteria:
- demiarch sync flush exports DB tables to .demiarch/sync and reports record counts
- demiarch sync import reads .demiarch/sync/*.jsonl into SQLite and reports counts/warnings
- demiarch sync status reports last sync time and pending changes using metadata/counts
- Commands fail with a clear message if no project is registered or has no path
notes: Implemented sync flush/import/status using storage::jsonl. Detects active project (current dir or most recent with path), errors if none. Flush exports counts and timestamp, import reads .demiarch/sync with warnings, status reports last sync/pending changes. Ran cargo check -p demiarch-cli.

title: Implement context + progressive disclosure
description: PRD FR6 requires progressive disclosure/context retrieval with summaries and search. The  commands currently return hard-coded zero counts and 'not yet implemented'. Implement context storage and summarization: persist chat/agent context summaries, support search/prune/rebuild, and expose real stats/pending tokens. Aim for 3-level summaries (index/timeline/full) and hooks from chat/agents to update summaries.
acceptance_criteria:
- Context stats reflect real counts/tokens from stored summaries
- Search returns matching summaries (by text/embedding)
- Prune/rebuild act on stored summaries
- Summaries generated/updated from chat/agent activity using 3-level progressive disclosure

title: Implement learned skills system
description: PRD FR7 calls for learned skills extraction, semantic search, and reuse. The  subcommands are placeholders (list/search/extract/delete show stub text) and no records are persisted. Migrations already define learned_skills/skill_embeddings/skill_activations tables. Implement the skills pipeline: persist learned skills, support list/show/search (by text + embeddings), allow manual add/delete, and wire extraction to agent outputs when available.
acceptance_criteria:
- Skills CLI returns real data from the database (list/show/search)
- Can create/ingest a learned skill record (manual or via extraction) and delete it
- Search supports text query + embedding similarity against skill_embeddings
- Skill activations/usage metrics update when skills are used

title: Implement graceful agent cancellation with CancellationToken
description:
Add ability to gracefully stop running agents from TUI, CLI, and web UI.

## Problem
Currently agents run to completion or fail - there's no way to cancel them externally. Users must kill the process (Ctrl+C) which is not graceful.

## Proposed Solution

### Core
1. Add CancellationToken to AgentContext (using tokio_util::sync::CancellationToken)
2. Propagate token through agent hierarchy (orchestrator → planner → workers)
3. Check token in agent execution loops before each LLM call
4. Cancelled status already exists in AgentStatus enum - use it properly

### CLI
- Add command: `demiarch agents stop` - stops all running agents
- Add command: `demiarch agents stop <agent-id>` - stops specific agent
- Show 'Stopping agents...' feedback

### TUI (demiarch-tui)
- Add keybind: 's' or 'Escape' to stop all agents
- Add keybind: 'x' to stop selected agent
- Show 'stopping...' state in agent tree during graceful shutdown
- Update status bar to show stop option

### Web UI (future)
- Add 'Stop' button next to running agents
- Add 'Stop All' button in toolbar
- Real-time status updates via WebSocket

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CancellationToken added to SharedState or AgentContext
- [ ] All agent types check cancellation before LLM calls
- [ ] CLI 'agents stop' command triggers cancellation
- [ ] TUI keybinds stop running agents
- [ ] Agents transition to Cancelled status properly
- [ ] Visual feedback in all UIs during cancellation
